verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"Should a wise man <S%H2450><s%> answer <S%H6030><s%> with vain <S%H7307><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> and fill <S%H4390><s%> himself <S%H990><s%> with the east wind? <S%H6921><s%>
Should he reason <S%H3198><s%> with unprofitable <S%H5532><s%> talk, <S%H1697><s%> or with speeches <S%H4405><s%> with which he can do no good? <S%H3276><s%>

For your iniquity <S%H5771><s%> teaches <S%H502><s%> your mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and you choose <S%H977><s%> the language <S%H3956><s%> of the crafty. <S%H6175><s%>
Your own mouth <S%H6310><s%> condemns <S%H7561><s%> you, <S%H8193><s%> and not I. Yes, your own lips testify against you. <S%H6030><s%>
"Are you the first <S%H7223><s%> man <S%H120><s%> who was born? <S%H3205><s%> Or were you brought <S%H2342><s%> forth before <S%H6440><s%> the hills? <S%H1389><s%>
Have you heard <S%H8085><s%> the secret <S%H5475><s%> counsel of God? <S%H433><s%> Do you limit <S%H1639><s%> wisdom to yourself? <S%H2451><s%>
What do you know, <S%H3045><s%> that we don't <S%H3045><s%> know? What do you understand, <S%H995><s%> which is not in us?
With us are both the gray-headed <S%H7867><s%> and the very aged <S%H3453><s%> men, <S%H3524><s%> much elder <S%H3117><s%> than your father. <S%H1><s%>
Are the consolations <S%H8575><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> too small <S%H4592><s%> for you, <S%H1697><s%> even the word that is gentle toward you? <S%H328><s%>
Why does your heart <S%H3820><s%> carry you away? <S%H3947><s%> Why do your eyes <S%H5869><s%> flash, <S%H7335><s%>
That you turn <S%H7725><s%> your spirit <S%H7307><s%> against God, <S%H410><s%> and let such words <S%H4405><s%> go out <S%H3318><s%> of your mouth? <S%H6310><s%>
What is man, <S%H582><s%> that he should be clean? <S%H2135><s%> What is he who is born <S%H3205><s%> of a woman, <S%H802><s%> that he should be righteous? <S%H6663><s%>
Behold, <S%H539><s%> he puts no trust in his holy <S%H6918><s%> ones. <S%H8064><s%> Yes, the heavens are not clean <S%H2141><s%> in his sight; <S%H5869><s%>
how much less one <S%H376><s%> who is abominable <S%H8581><s%> and corrupt, <S%H376><s%> a man who drinks <S%H8354><s%> iniquity <S%H5766><s%> like water! <S%H4325><s%>
"I will show <S%H2331><s%> you, <S%H8085><s%> listen to me; <S%H2372><s%> that which I have seen I will declare: <S%H5608><s%>
(Which wise <S%H2450><s%> men have told <S%H5046><s%> by their fathers, <S%H1><s%> and have not hidden it; <S%H3582><s%>
to whom alone the land <S%H776><s%> was given, <S%H5414><s%> and no stranger <S%H2114><s%> passed <S%H5674><s%> among them <S%H8432><s%>):

the wicked <S%H7563><s%> man writhes <S%H2342><s%> in pain all his days, <S%H3117><s%> even the number <S%H4557><s%> of years <S%H8141><s%> that are laid <S%H6845><s%> up for the oppressor. <S%H6184><s%>
A sound <S%H6963><s%> of terrors <S%H6343><s%> is in his ears. <S%H241><s%> In prosperity <S%H7965><s%> the destroyer <S%H7703><s%> shall come on him. <S%H935><s%>
He doesn't <S%H539><s%> believe that he shall return <S%H7725><s%> out of darkness. <S%H2822><s%> He is waited <S%H6822><s%> for by the sword. <S%H2719><s%>

He wanders abroad <S%H5074><s%> for bread, <S%H3899><s%> saying, <S%H3045><s%> 'Where is it?' He knows that the day <S%H3117><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%> is ready <S%H3559><s%> at his hand. <S%H3027><s%>
Distress <S%H6862><s%> and anguish <S%H4691><s%> make him afraid. <S%H1204><s%> They prevail <S%H8630><s%> against him, <S%H4428><s%> as a king ready <S%H6264><s%> to the battle. <S%H3593><s%>
Because he has stretched out <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> against God, <S%H410><s%> and behaves himself proudly <S%H1396><s%> against the Almighty; <S%H7706><s%>
he runs <S%H7323><s%> at him with a stiff neck, <S%H6677><s%> with the thick <S%H5672><s%> shields <S%H1354><s%> of his bucklers; <S%H4043><s%>
because he has covered <S%H3680><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> with his fatness, <S%H2459><s%> and gathered <S%H6213><s%> fat <S%H6371><s%> on his thighs. <S%H3689><s%>
He has lived <S%H7931><s%> in desolate <S%H3582><s%> cities, <S%H5892><s%> in houses <S%H1004><s%> which no one inhabited, <S%H3427><s%> which were ready <S%H6257><s%> to become heaps. <S%H1530><s%>

He shall not be rich, <S%H6238><s%> neither shall his substance <S%H2428><s%> continue, <S%H6965><s%> neither shall their possessions <S%H5186><s%> be extended <S%H4512><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%>

He shall not depart <S%H5493><s%> out of darkness. <S%H2822><s%> The flame <S%H7957><s%> shall dry up <S%H3001><s%> his branches. <S%H3127><s%> By the breath <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H6310><s%>'s mouth shall he go away. <S%H5493><s%>
Let him not trust <S%H539><s%> in emptiness, <S%H7723><s%> deceiving <S%H8582><s%> himself; <S%H7723><s%> for emptiness shall be his reward. <S%H8545><s%>
It shall be accomplished <S%H4390><s%> before <S%H3808><s%> his time. <S%H3117><s%> His branch <S%H3712><s%> shall not be green. <S%H7488><s%>
He shall shake off <S%H2554><s%> his unripe grape <S%H1154><s%> as the vine, <S%H1612><s%> and shall cast off <S%H7993><s%> his flower <S%H5328><s%> as the olive tree. <S%H2132><s%>
For the company <S%H5712><s%> of the godless <S%H2611><s%> shall be barren, <S%H1565><s%> and fire <S%H784><s%> shall consume <S%H398><s%> the tents <S%H168><s%> of bribery. <S%H7810><s%>
They conceive <S%H2029><s%> mischief, <S%H5999><s%> and bring forth <S%H3205><s%> iniquity. <S%H205><s%> Their heart <S%H990><s%> prepares <S%H3559><s%> deceit. <S%H4820><s%>"
